title: Lawfulness
description: Fairness & Transparency
category: Personal data must be processed lawfully
tags: fairly and in a transparent manner.

title: Lawfulness of Processing
description: Processing must have at least one legal basis: consent

title: Conditions for Consent
description: Consent must be freely given

title: Transparent Information
description: Communication with data subjects must be concise

title: Information When Collecting Data
description: Controller must provide identity
column8: and rights of data subjects when collecting data.

title: Information When Data Not Obtained From Data Subject
description: Same as Art 13 but for data obtained from third parties.

title: Right of Access
description: Data subject has right to obtain confirmation of processing and access to their personal data.

title: Right to Rectification
description: Data subject has right to have inaccurate personal data rectified without undue delay.

title: Right to Erasure ("Right to be Forgotten")
description: Data subject has right to have personal data erased under specific conditions.

title: Right to Restriction of Processing
description: Data subject has right to restrict processing under specific conditions.

title: Notification Obligation
description: Controller must communicate any rectification
category: erasure or restriction to each recipient of the data.

title: Right to Data Portability
description: Data subject has right to receive their data in structured
tags: machine-readable format and transmit to another controller.

title: Right to Object
description: Data subject has right to object to processing based on legitimate interests or direct marketing.

title: Automated Decision-Making
description: Data subject has right not to be subject to decisions based solely on automated processing

title: Controller Responsibility
description: Controller must implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to ensure and demonstrate compliance.

title: Data Protection by Design & Default
description: Controller must implement data protection principles and safeguards into processing activities.

title: Processor Requirements
description: Processor must provide sufficient guarantees and implement appropriate technical and organizational measures.

title: Records of Processing Activities
description: Controller and processor must maintain records of processing activities.

title: Security of Processing
description: Controller and processor must implement appropriate security measures considering risks.

title: Notification of Data Breach
description: Controller must notify supervisory authority of breach within 72 hours unless unlikely to result in risk.

title: Communication of Data Breach
description: Controller must communicate breach to data subjects when likely to result in high risk.

title: Data Protection Impact Assessment
description: Controller must conduct DPIA when processing likely to result in high risk.

title: Prior Consultation
description: Controller must consult supervisory authority prior to processing if DPIA indicates high risk and no mitigation.

title: Data Protection Officer
description: Controller and processor must designate DPO in certain cases.

title: Consent via Clear Affirmative Action
description: Consent must be by clear affirmative action establishing a freely given

title: Transparency Principle
description: Information and communication must be easily accessible and easy to understand

title: Right to Lodge Complaint
description: Data subject has right to lodge complaint with supervisory authority.

title: Administrative Fines
description: Supervisory authority can impose fines up to 4% of global annual turnover or â‚¬20 million

title: Binding Corporate Rules
description: Group of undertakings can use BCRs for transfers within group.

title: General Principle for Transfers
description: Transfers to third countries may take place only if conditions in Chapter V are met.

title: Derogations for Specific Situations
description: Specific derogations for transfers when no adequacy decision or appropriate safeguards.

title: Codes of Conduct
description: Associations may prepare codes of conduct to contribute to proper application of GDPR.

title: Certification
description: Data protection certification mechanisms and seals to demonstrate compliance.

title: Right to Human Intervention
description: Right to obtain human intervention
tags: and contest decision in automated decision-making.

title: Conditions Applicable to Child's Consent
description: For information society services offered directly to child
category: consent valid from age 16 (Member States may lower to 13-16).

title: Processing of Special Categories
description: Prohibition of processing special categories of data with specific exceptions.
